channel.title: [Class Suggestion] The Retainer - The Vassal
channel.description:
# [color=lighblue]The Retainer (Blue Dragon Support)[/color]
_Passive: Royal Blood - You can step up as King during elections_
**Night Ability 1: Personal Escort** - Infinite uses You will grant your target occupy immunity tonight and can not be effected by visit blocking abilities.
**Night Ability 2: Personal Vouch** - 2 uses Select a living target, if your target is voted to a trial during the day, you can use Jury.
**Day Ability 2: Jury** - Special Your votes toward the accused target will be counted as 2. If the King uses Decide Fate, you will instead negate it and your vote will be counted as 1. (King retains the use of Decide Fate)
# [color=purple]The Vassal (Unseen Support)[/color]
_Passive: Royal Blood - You can step up as King during elections_
**Night Ability: Personal Escort** - Infinite uses You will grant a member of the Unseen occupy immunity tonight and can not be effected by visit blocking abilities.
**Day Ability: Life-link** - 1 use Select a target. If you are killed in any sort of way, you will take down your life-link partner. Active for 3 days, first day is the day it was used.
-----
The most basic of Classes but it's actually something I took a shine to after I made it.

item.title: [Class Suggestion] The Retainer - The Vassal
item.dc:creator: Hippolytus
item.description:
Maid is my favourite new class I agree. Clearly it’s main function is to compare alignments to find scum. As this is weak on it’s own she has that one-use INVESTIGATIVE ability. These two abilities are what compromise Maid, and what defines her. On top of that she has the more situational find Royal Blood, which noone considers the main part of her kit.

To clarify, I am not saying ewwww this class has too much utility and has too much variety. That is always good. But it’s variety needs to be tied into a key concept of what the class is - it’s role in the team and function. The Retainer lacks that clarity of purpose and presents itself as a Frankenstein mishmash of abilities.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Suggestion] The Retainer - The Vassal
item.dc:creator: ThePlex
item.description:
I don’t think a class should have a sole ability that defines them… having variety is better.

Like Ruby’s Maid.

Read full topic

That is a theme. Good for lore but I am talking game-mechanical wise.

item.title: [Class Suggestion] The Retainer - The Vassal
item.dc:creator: ThePlex
item.description:
Actually, I believe it’s defining feature is getting Personal with people.

Escorting them, Voting for/against them.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Suggestion] The Retainer - The Vassal
item.dc:creator: Hippolytus
item.description:
I’m not asking for all of the abilities to be under the same theme, that would be weird. It is fine to have totally different abilities - CW stopping day abilities has nothing to do with Ice Walling people. What I am trying to say as it is CLEAR that the crux of the CW is his ice wall. That is what defines him.

For the Retainer he has nothing that truly defines him and is caught between two worlds.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Suggestion] The Retainer - The Vassal
item.dc:creator: ThePlex
item.description:
Retainer may refer to: Retainer (medieval), a person, especially a soldier, in the service of a lord in the late Middle Ages.

Personal Escort - To walk with someone through the Castle to ensure no distractions.

Personal Vouch - To vouch for a lord at the table, whether it’s for or against them.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Suggestion] The Retainer - The Vassal
item.dc:creator: Hippolytus
item.description:
I dunno, I like a lot of your ideas but this one doesn’t feel like a class, just a few interesting abilities mashed together.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Suggestion] The Retainer - The Vassal
item.dc:creator: Hippolytus
item.description:
Nobles have abilities to do with spreading information. They are a social class who specialise in spreading information (although let’s face it really the purpose of a Noble is to be King, everything else is kind of secondary).

The ONLY class I can think of which has multiple purposes is, as you say Butler. He has two primary roles - to occupy AND to kill the King. His party throwing ability however is more of a Gimick that was just added, it is hardly one of the main purposes of the class.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Suggestion] The Retainer - The Vassal
item.dc:creator: RopeStringFace
item.description:
completely agree. [quote=“ThePlex, post:38, topic:2533”]
Butler/Servant abilities -

Occupy people
Stop whispers
[/quote]

I imagine that the party throwing is just temporary.

ThePlex:

Noble/Aristocrat abilities -

Send a letter
Spy on whispers

one allows to privately send a message, the other allow to listen in on messages. not that big a difference.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Suggestion] The Retainer - The Vassal
item.dc:creator: ThePlex
item.description:
Butler/Servant abilities -

  1. Occupy people
  2. Stop whispers

Noble/Aristocrat abilities -

  1. Send a letter
  2. Spy on whispers

Synergy isn’t exactly a big deal when it comes to ToL…

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Suggestion] The Retainer - The Vassal
item.dc:creator: Hippolytus
item.description:
I just do not think they have any synergy and are sort of misjointedly joined together, reducing the amount of strategy playing this class.

Even abilities which at first glance don’t fit together - Like Princess’ Wasp - are actually integral to the class, and thats what makes them great. Without it no one would ever believe the easy as Princess claim.

I just don’t really see why these abilities go together in any way, sorry.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Suggestion] The Retainer - The Vassal
item.dc:creator: ThePlex
item.description:
Hippolytus:

I dunno I like both of the abilities but they just do not really seem to fir together.

I like to think that abilities that don’t fit together, go great together.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Suggestion] The Retainer - The Vassal
item.dc:creator: Hippolytus
item.description:
I dunno I like both of the abilities but they just do not really seem to fir together.

Princess has an investigative ability and an ability to prove herself in order to get the scum she found hung (which can also function as a hindrance to attackers).

The point of Observer, like it says on the wiki I think, is that he can find out vast amounts of information in very little time but to counter-act this he has no abilities to prove himself.

Priest for example can revive, and to ensure he survives long enough until a good BD dies he has a one time-vest. Sure, his grant immunity ability is sort of random, but that is not considered a large part of his kit.

Most class’ main purpose you can sum up very easily - Knight kills scum, Phsycican heals, CW blocks and protects, etcetera. I just think this class is stuck halfway between two (very interesting) concepts.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Suggestion] The Retainer - The Vassal
item.dc:creator: RopeStringFace
item.description:
you should make thee vassal the “chauffeur.” For both, personal escort makes observer see “your target left with a chauffeur”, makes them immune to being occupied that night, allows them to bypass ice ward, and allows them to bypass the mercenary’s/sell sword’s stand guard/stonewall.

Also, life-link is kind of weird.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Suggestion] The Retainer - The Vassal
item.dc:creator: ThePlex
item.description:
Hippolytus:

I don’t quite understand the synergy between Personal Escort and the voting ability. It almost seems like you put a few separate ability ideas together. Do you mind explaining your thought process on that?

Observer has the ability to see who visits and who they visit and see somebodies faction.
Princess has the ability to check someone’s class type and reveal people who visits her.

Synergy isn’t exactly a huge deal in this game

But in my mind, “Personal” came to mind. Personally escorting somebody and Personally voting somebody.

Hippolytus:

The one you just had with Rope about the time you posted…

Not even going into it.

Read full topic
